programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Larger Than Life'' - The designers meet Joanna Coles, Editor in Chief of Marie Claire magazine, for their biggest challenge yet. They are told that they are to create designs that epitomize the Marie Claire woman. The winning look will be displayed on a 50-foot billboard in NYC. Joanna guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''It's a Party'' - It's anything but party time when the designers get their Unconventional Materials Challenge: to make chic looks out of party supplies. But when the designers' models walk through the doors, the designers learn that there is a catch that may push them to their limits. The "Queen of Unconventional Fashion," Betsey Johnson, guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Hats Off to You'' - The designers are left scratching their heads when faced with Project Runway's first hat-inspired challenge. They must design garments influenced by the outrageous hats of famed British milliner Philip Treacy, who also guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''There IS an "I" in Team'' - The designers get their first taste of a Team Challenge when they are split into two teams and tasked with creating a cohesive line to match the hair trends for 2010. Georgina Chapman and Heather Kerzner guest judge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''You Can Totally Wear That Again'' - The designers select real former bridesmaids and prove that their dresses can be worn again after redesigning the looks. But will they be able to handle the pressure when they have to present their work to the public? Designer Cynthia Rowley guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''What's Mine is Yours'' - Project Runway sets sail when the designers get a resort wear challenge from Michael Kors. But when they discover who is actually creating their visions, some designers may want to walk the plank! Actress Kristen Bell guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''A Rough Day on the Runway'' - The designers get a lesson on fashionable politics when they learn about the creation and longevity of American sportswear. Actress January Jones guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Race to the Finish'' - The stakes are raised in all directions when the designers are challenged to create a high fashion look and the winner receives one of the biggest rewards in Project Runway history.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''There's A Pattern Here'' - The designers take a trip down memory lane when old photos of themselves pop up in the workroom. But they are quickly brought back to the present when they are tasked with designing their own fabric and garment to correspond with a memorable time in their lives. One designer reveals an emotional secret that leaves everyone shocked and in tears. Designer Rachel Roy guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''A Look in the Line'' - The designers get an opportunity to create a look for the launch of Heidi Klum's own ready-to-wear line. The remaining designers discover that they need to enlist some help when Heidi throws a curveball at them. Designer Norma Camalli guest judges.

programme.title: Battle of Los Angeles
programme.desc: In February 1942 US forces engaged an unidentified flying object above Los Angeles. Now almost 70 years later, the alien invaders have returned.

programme.title: CarGo
programme.desc: A young car learns the importance of family when he embarks on a mission to rescue his father - who's been sent to Clunker Island to be repurposed as junk metal.

programme.title: Hercules Reborn
programme.desc: When a young man's bride is kidnapped by an evil king, he turns to Hercules for help. The fallen hero has been living in exile, banished for killing his family, but the young man's courage inspires Hercules. Together, they fight to rescue the bride and reclaim Hercules' honor.

programme.title: Jane White is Sick and Twisted
programme.desc: Jane White (Kim Little) is a disturbed young woman living in her own bizarre TV fantasy land. For Jane, life itself is a television program, and she dreams of becoming a star on the small screen. Convincing herself that Gerry King (David L. Lander), a popular talk show host, is her birth father, she sets out on an adventurous road trip -- aided by her equally looney boyfriend, Dick (Wil Wheaton) -- to confront her "father" on the air, and, just maybe, make a splash on reality television.

programme.title: Mega Shark vs Giant Octopus
programme.desc: Strange things are afoot in the depths of the sea. First a passenger plane vanishes over the Pacific Ocean. Then an oil platform is obliterated. Marine biologist Emma MacNeil (Deborah Gibson) is dispatched to investigate the phenomena, and, with the help of Japanese scientist Seiji Shimada (Vic Chao), she makes a discovery that will rock the world: An enormous prehistoric shark and a giant octopus have been awakened from their icy slumbers -- and they're hungry.

programme.title: Merlin and the War of the Dragons
programme.desc: Before growing into the legendary adviser to the Pendragons, a youthful Merlin spends his days studying with the Mage (Jürgen Prochnow), a master sorcerer, and honing his magical skills. When a fellow apprentice sorcerer, Hengest (Iago McGuire), grows jealous of Merlin's rapid progress, he rebels against their mutual mentor and betrays King Vortigen (Hefin Wyn) to Saxon invaders. As Hengest conjures an army of dragons, Merlin prepares to test his developing abilities in battle.

programme.title: ALTER Collection | Women in Horror Vol. 1

programme.title: The Tangerine Bear

But if Yahzee should fall into enemy hands, how far will Enders go to save the military's most powerful secret? John Woo directs this action-packed epic inspired by the true story of the Navajo soldiers whose courage and sacrifices helped win the war in the Pacific.

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Lucy'' - If Brandon can earn the trust of a fearful Chihuahua mix named Lucy, the dog could become the perfect companion for a partially paralyzed adrenaline junkie who's trying to get back on her feet.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Yogi'' - A chocolate lab mix named Yogi seems like the perfect companion for a couple of empty nesters. But until Brandon can help the dog overcome a severe case of anxiety, his training and transition home must be put on hold.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Polly'' - Brandon thinks a young, timid German Shepherd mix could be the perfect match for a beach-going family with kids. But before Polly will be ready to hit the waves, Brandon must lure this pup out of her shell.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Estella'' - When a former "Lucky Dog" family shows interest in adopting a second dog, Brandon thinks he has the perfect fit. But only time and training will tell if the Cotter family's Tibetan Terrier, Pluto, ends up with a new furry friend.

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Max'' - A previously bitten Miniature Poodle shows signs of aggression towards large dogs. Before he's ready to be adopted, Brandon has to help him move past his fear and aggression.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Life Changers'' - We revisit five of Lucky Dog's most lifesaving and life-changing adoptions, including a hearing-impaired Poodle mix that learns sign language and a Labrador that answers the call of duty for a diabetic veteran.

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: How to Cook a Deep-Fried Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In our season finale, Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a regional specialty from Tennessee: The deep-fried burger! At a place called Dyer's in Memphis, burgers are smashed paper thin and dipped in a skillet filled with hot beef tallow-a method that harkens back to the dawn of the original hamburger. Grease is an heirloom at Dyer's. When you bite into a burger from there, you're biting into history. That's because the same grease has been used since 1912!

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Patty Melt with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook his favorite patty melt! Motz says this is the burger he dreams about all the time, and you'll quickly learn why it's so unique. Borrowing a method from Wisconsin burger shacks, Motz poaches the hamburger patty in beef stock and slides it in between a grilled cheese. This is truly regional hamburger nirvana.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Double Cheeseburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook one of the most important hamburgers in America-the original double cheeseburger from Southern California's iconic Bob's Big Boy Restaurant. This is the double burger that birthed all other double burgers (and even predates the invention of the Big Mac by almost 30 years!). Learn how to make a perfect double cheeseburger at home while soaking up some hamburger history.

programme.title: How to Cook 2 Regional Fast-Food Burgers with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is taking you on a ride through regional American fast-food burger history! A lot of the big, commercial fast-food places have given the hamburger a bad wrap. Which is why George wants to set the record straight and show you two family-owned, hyper-regional burger chains that still do it right-Swensons in Ohio, and Fat Mo's in Tennessee. These beloved burgers are highly unique, and take a few twists and turns to get to the finished product.

programme.title: How to Cook a Spicy Malaysian Egg Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In this special episode of Burger Scholar Sessions, George Motz pulls back the curtain on an international street-food icon: the spicy Malaysian egg burger! This burger is so famous that it goes by several names-the Ramly Burger, the Sloppy Burger, and the "Sampah" Burger, which translates to "rubbish" in Malaysia. But this burger isn't rubbish at all it's a total flavor bomb. Wrapped in an egg and covered with spices, it's one of the craziest burgers George has ever tried.

programme.title: Lorde Drops the Mic While Eating Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Lorde is a two-time Grammy Award-winning singer-songwriter, and she's back with her much-anticipated third studio album, Solar Power. The latest single, "Stoned at the Nail Salon," is out now, and there's a multi-continent tour set to begin next year. But how is she with spicy food? Find out as the New Zealand pop powerhouse takes on the wings of death and discusses the sound of cicadas, the art of songwriting, and the keys to a perfect onion ring

In this episode of Coneheads, Mike Chen teams up with Hot Ones host Sean Evans for a deep dive into the perplexing yet magical world of spicy ice cream.

The latest single, "Straightenin," is out now with the group's upcoming fourth studio album Culture III set to release on June 11th. But how is he with spicy food? programme.title: NIKI and Inga Lam Share Indomie Noodle Hacks
programme.desc: Indomie is one of Indonesia's most beloved cultural exports. But what happens when you use mie goreng to make burgers and chocolate bars? Indonesian icon NIKI has been an Indomie purist since day one, but today she's teaming up with BuzzFeed's Inga Lam in the hopes of broadening her stir-fried noodle horizons. Together, NIKI and Ingra run through a few of their favorite ways to trick out a pack of instant noodles. Which mie goreng metamorphosis is NIKI's favorite?

programme.title: South LA's African American Taco Movement
programme.desc: Miss Info meets a group of young, charismatic African-American entrepreneurs from Watts, South L.A, and Compton who are shaking up the taco scene, finding new meaning in L.A.'s iconic street food. Find out how upstarts like All Flavor No Grease and Taco Mell are making a name for themselves, and why rapper Casey Veggies says, "The food game turned into the rap game."

programme.title: One Life To Blossom
programme.desc: One Life To Blossom follows the life of black transgender activist Blossom C. Brown when she undergoes her dream of getting face feminization surgery all within a year before making nationwide headlines at the 2019 CNN LBGTQ+ Town Hall.

programme.title: My Trans Life
programme.desc: Being trans is a mental, physical and emotional journey and MY TRANS LIFE showcases inspiring trans individuals on their journeys of acceptance. From preparing for major surgery, to tackling love lives, to campaigning for equality, MY TRANS LIFE follows transgender people facing the world in the body they were meant to be in.

programme.title: Drag Kids
programme.desc: Drag has always been about breaking down barriers and daring to do the unexpected. Now, a new type of queen is on the scene: she's fierce, she's living in a time of unprecedented access to queer culture, and she's younger than ever before. She's a drag kid and she's a long way from the era of the queens who led the Stonewall Riots nearly 50 years ago. Stephan, Jason, Bracken and Nemis have never met, but they're united by a shared passion for drag. They are about to come together for the first time - to perform Lady Gaga's 'Born This Way' at the world-famous Montreal Pride Festival. As they prepare for the big show, each faces their own unique challenges, as well as challenges they have in common - deep feelings of isolation and the struggle of trying to claim a place of your own on the fringes of a fringe culture. Drag Kids is a beautiful, daring, and touching portrait of four kids chasing freedom and friendship through the art of drag.

programme.title: The Keyes to Murder
programme.desc: Some of the world's most notorious murders are the subject of "It Takes a Killer," which investigates the crimes from the perspective of the killers, trying to get inside their minds and determine their motives. Leading homicide investigators and experts from such agencies as the FBI and Scotland Yard take a look at the evidence pulled from crime scenes and profile the killer's behavior to try to piece together the details of each murder, explaining when, why and how each criminal committed the crime. For the wannabe detectives watching the show, the experts also reveal how the crime was solved -- which often requires authorities to think like a killer.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond hosts another episode of TV's stupidest, brightest and most insane game show. In this series, the obstacles have been made bigger and brasher than ever, ensuring bigger bumps, crunches, smashes, and splashes.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty contestants take on one of television's largest and most extreme obstacle courses in order to win 10,000 pounds and get to 'The Final'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard's co-host Amanda Byram is course-side in Buenos Aires as 20 foolhardy Brits tackle the purpose-built Argentinian course. There is a 10,000 pound prize for the winner and the additional plaudit of being crowned the Total Wipeout champion. To get there all the winner has to do is master the Sucker Punch, the Big Red Balls, Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants – male and female, young and old, fit and not-so-fit – take on four grueling, but wildly funny obstacle courses to win the title of the seventh Wipeout Champion and the grand cash prize.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Throughout this season, contestants have fallen, bounced and swung to win the prize, but only seven of them could achieve it. This is the last episode of the season and the seven previous winners compete to be crowned Champion of Champions. This time they face games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'Legends Special' and today all the worst but funniest competitors from the last three series have been invited back to have another go on the TV show. This time they have invited the 'Dodgeball Men' that appear during 'The Qualifier' game and, as you might remember, they throw dodgeballs at contestants while they attempt to cross the pontoons over water.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond presents the annual Total Wipeout trophy-athon where they celebrate the highs, the lows and the biggest splashes from the whole season. The presenter starts with the new 'Best Slip and Trip Award' and will be showing the top five, and the winner for each category. Don't miss this special episode!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the first 'Celebrity Special' of the season. You will see how ten celebrities compete and risk everything in the name of charity. However, this time, all of them face 'The Qualifier' and 'The Crash Mountain'. Celebrities are Michaela Strachan, Siân Lloyd, Joe Absolom, Antony Costa, Kate Lawler, Ninia Benjamin, Jeff Brazier, Iwan Thomas, and Tony Tobin.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In the first episode of season 3, Richard Hammond introduces a brand new challenge called Crash Mountain. This involves the twelve remaining contestants from round one standing on podiums over water while three robotic arms swing around in a circular motion to knock them off.

programme.title: Reel West Coast S3:E8 "Aguilar House Bamfield"

programme.title: Gale Force Twins S1:E7 "How To Anchor At The Sandbar Or Beach By Boat - Understanding Tide & Current"
programme.desc: How many times have you tried to anchor your boat at the sandbar or beach and stressed about it? No one wants to be "that person" who ends up high and dry when the tide goes out! I would think 100% of boaters have hit bottom at least once in their lifetime. If they say they haven't well they are probably just not telling the truth. We have been there ourselves! In this video we cover what tide charts we use, how to properly read them and what questions you should be asking yourself BEFORE setting up at the sandbar. We go over how to read the water, watch for fellow boaters and understand what anchor you should be throwing! We hope you find this video helpful and feel confident at your next sandbar or beach anchor adventure! https://www.galeforcefishing.com

programme.title: Gale Force Twins S1:E8 "Diving For Dinner – Catching Florida Keys Spiny Lobster"
programme.desc: Swimming in strong currents to catch your dinner is about as rewarding as it gets! Although diving in the Florida Keys beautiful blue green water may sound peaceful and relaxing, lobstering is much more of an expedition! Whether being towed by a boat or searching for lobster tentacles by snorkeling around it can definitely become quite the task. Our first lobster spot had only small non-keeper lobsters so we got back into the boat and continued our hunt. The second location had deeper water and much stronger current but we quickly saw the tentacles got to work on catching our dinner! https://www.galeforcefishing.com

programme.title: HuntStand Media S1:E1 "On Top Of The World - A Rocky Mountain Bighorn Sheep Hunt (Part 1)"
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke, a lifelong big game hunter, never imagined he would ever get the chance to hunt Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep. But then he found a way. Watch his hunt of a lifetime unfold in the first part of this HuntStand Original Film.

programme.title: HuntStand Media S1:E1 "On Top Of The World - A Rocky Mountain Bighorn Sheep Hunt (Part 2)"
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke, a lifelong big game hunter, never imagined he would ever get the chance to hunt Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep. But then he found a way. Watch his hunt of a lifetime unfold in the second part of this HuntStand Original Film.

programme.title: HuntStand Media S1:E2 "Bulls On The Border"
programme.desc: After a 5-year hiatus from vertical bowhunting, Josh Dahlke gets a phone call from a friend that compels him to pick up a compound bow again and prepare for a bucket-list hunt. Dahlke and Mike Mattly head to the legendary Gila region of New Mexico to go after rutting bull elk. But they’re once again reminded that bowhunting is often a long game, with no guarantees—even if you’re hunting in one of the best elk units in the country

programme.title: The Raven Project S1:E1 "Raven Show One Alpha"
programme.desc: From the ground up host Randy Birdsong will take you through the trials and tribulations of owning his first farm and grooming it to be one of the best whitetail hunting properties in the country

programme.title: Limitless S1:E3 "Lake Murray"
programme.desc: The 3rd event of the season was a fun one! A little stumble on day one set up a big day 2 comeback! Fishing the herring spawn can be absolute chaos. the bass set up and respond in such particular ways. It was a fun week trying to figure them out. If you could get the timing right, the bite was incredible.

programme.title: Storytellers S1:E1 "The Hill"
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Storytellers S1:E2 "Axis In July"
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Chasing November S6:E1 "Jared's First Velvet Buck, The Chase Begins"
programme.desc: Jared Mills hunts the state of Kentucky and tags his first velvet buck ever. Rye Ludwig harvests a big framed 9 pointer in Maryland. The team sets the stage for our best season in Chasing November history.

programme.title: Chasing November S6:E2 "Once In A Lifetime Velvet Buck In Iowa"
programme.desc: Josh Sparks tags a once in a lifetime, giant velvet buck in Iowa. Mike Reed takes a shot at one of his target bucks. Grant Noble encounters an awesome new stud working a scrape line

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E7 "Deadly Setup: The Open Gate"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we first join Bill as he takes down stands across the farm, inspecting them to make sure they're safe. One of the stands he made his way to was one of the deadliest stands on the entire farm, the "Open Gate." Bill goes into detail on why this stand works so well and relives two successful hunts. Then we join Josh Honeycutt in Kentucky, who gives us an update on how his off-season has been going and introduces his plans to catch up with his top targets this coming fall.

programme.title: Road Trips S1:E7 "Tyler Tags a Grigsby Stud | Hunting the Rut in Illinois"
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan's road trip continues in Illinois. The guys head to the legendary Grigsby Farm. After multiple encounters with a big deer, Jordan is finally able to put a great buck on the ground

programme.title: Road Trips S1:E8 "Breaking the Kentucky Curse | A Bluegrass Bow Buck Double"
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Bryan Brown head north to their Kentucky Lease. The rut is heating up. Brown is up to bat first, and Tyler jumps behind the lens. The weather is perfect for this road trip. Let's go.

programme.title: Team200 S7:E7 "Traditional Whitetails part 2"

programme.title: Team200 S7:E8 "Giant whitetails in Kentucky and Missouri"

programme.title: Rival Wild S6:E7 "Peak Rut"

Lee VanDenBrink is down in Missouri for the gun opener and has quite the encounter with a good buck.

programme.desc: Ken Hayworth piicks up his Muzzleloader to head aftera BIG heavy 6x5, but success will take a little ingenuity.

programme.desc: All aboard! In this episode, Luke hops on the train in Ga Thap Cham, and soon finds himself in beautiful Nha Trang- a region of Vietnam with a similar vibe to the French Riviera! Tag along as Luke hand-catches some tasty seafood, explores the streets for some fresh durian fruit, and visit a barramundi farm where they harvest sea grapes!

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Railway Vietnam
programme.desc: After a 10-hour train ride from Da Nang, Luke finds himself in the charming World Hertitage listed town of Hoi An. Follow Luke as he visits a family who has been making chilli sauce for 5 generations, stops by the Historic Japanese Covered Bridge built in 1719, and meets a 4th generation blacksmith who is cleverly creating knives from bomb shells dropped during the Vietnam War!

programme.desc: We uncover the secrets to beef Burgundy at its best and show you a way to make portions of it ahead of time.

programme.title: Lemon Meringue Pie
programme.desc: Lemon meringue pie is a three-part recipe-crust, lemon filling, and meringue-and each one can be a challenge. We discover which rolling pins are best and whether you can use store-bought pie crust in a pinch. Then we perfect the filling and meringue.

programme.title: Chicken in a Pot
programme.desc: French country cooking has a way with chicken in a pot, whether it's the famous chicken with 40 cloves of garlic or the lesser-known chicken Provençal. These dishes take chicken to new heights-or go awry.

programme.title: Favorite Italian Classics
programme.desc: We demonstrate Italian dishes: Grilled Chicken alla Diavola, Frico, and Strawberries with Balsamic Vinegar.

programme.title: Texas Rib House
programme.desc: Huge meaty flavor-combined with spice, smoke, and fire-epitomizes Texas barbecue. Could we figure out how to make authentic Texas beef ribs in our Boston-based test kitchen?

programme.title: Simple Soups
programme.desc: Most cooks are under the impression that good soup takes all day to prepare. Maybe that's what our mothers wanted us to think, but the truth is that homemade soup need not be a complicated affair. We'll show you how to make simplified versions of two favorite soups: chicken noodle and Italian pasta and bean.

programme.title: Meat and Potatoes
programme.desc: What's for Sunday dinner? Around many American tables, it's meat and potatoes. Beef brisket is a good choice and a nice change from pot roast or beef stew. Although inexpensive and not so difficult to prepare, brisket does pose some challenges to the cook.

programme.title: Let's Talk Turkey
programme.desc: Thanksgiving can strike fear into the heart of even the most proficient cook. First, there's the turkey to contend with-in no other meal is the main course paraded in front of guests with as much fanfare. Sweet potato casserole is often considered another must-have. With our recipes for these Thanksgiving standards, we minimize the work so that the cook can enjoy the holiday as much as everyone else.

programme.title: Meat and Potatoes for Company
programme.desc: Few main courses are as impressive as filet mignon, but such cachet comes with a hefty price tag. While the hallmark of this luxury cut is its buttery, tender texture, some argue that the beefy flavor is too mild, lacking the oomph of fattier cuts like rib eye. So we aim to boost the filet mignon's flavor with a lively peppercorn crust and a rich pan sauce.

programme.title: Sunday Roast Chicken and Stuffing
programme.desc: We wanted a streamlined version of roast chicken with plenty of stuffing to go around. First we needed to solve the problem of cooking the stuffing to a safe temperature without drying out the delicate breast meat of the chicken.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Blueberry Bombshells
programme.desc: Portland, Oregon’s natural bounty is on display at the restaurants of famed chef Vitaly Paley. Chef finds himself in the Cascade foothills in search of the perfect berry. We learn about all varieties of blueberries and even get a chance to mingle with the resident falcon on patrol.Then its into the kitchen to create several dishes where the Northwest blueberry plays starring role.

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Stir-fry Tofu with Spicy Basil Tomatoes
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking a stir-fry tofu with spicy basil tomatoes, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Pepper Mushroom Rice & Venison Stew
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Pepper Mushroom Rice & Venison Stew!

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Soybean
programme.desc: It’s probably the most versatile and revered legume in Asia, while in the West, soy and soy products are being hailed only now for their health benefits. From bean to tofu, Hawaii Cooks looks at the many ways soybeans are utilized in the islands.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Smoked Pork and Apple Tiddy Oggy
Dine & Dish Nation - Prime & Proper Andiamo's One-Eyed Betty’s
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Chris Guyor, Nailah Ellis-Brown and Niki Calme, who review sophisticated specialties at the Prime & Proper Steakhouse original Italian recipes at the iconic Andiamo restaurant and favorite dishes - and beer - at the New Orleans' influenced, One-Eyed Betty's.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Penn’s Personal Brewery
programme.desc: William Penn’s approach to ale making is brought to life at his home, Pennsbury Manor. Recipes include sausage dumplings with a mushroom ale sauce, and roasted potatoes with sausage & sage.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - Dishes for Every Palate
programme.desc: Martin whips up three delectable dishes that are sure to please any discriminating palate. Today it’s shrimp, chicken and trout as only Chef Yan can.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Pomegranate
programme.desc: Watch Chef Staib make Roasted Salmon with Avocado and Pomegranate Seeds, a Quinoa Pomegranate Salad as well.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Hans Hickel, Victor Gielisse, and Rene Bajeux
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Crab Chowder with Roasted Red Pepper, Poached Chicken Breast, and Banana Fritters with Mango Creme Anglaise. Restaurants include: Oystercatchers in Tampa, CFT/Zale-Lipshey Hospital in Dallas, and The Grill Room in New Orleans.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Chicken Chronicles
programme.desc: Beginning in Andong, the spiritual capital of Korea, Marja participates in the area’s festive masked dance ritual and learns about the local salted mackerel before getting into jjimtak, Andong’s real knockout speciality. Along Chicken Alley, Marja and her adopted cousin April sample tons of the spicy stir-fry made with chicken, noodles and vegetables.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - Blueberry Bombshells
programme.desc: Portland, Oregon’s natural bounty is on display at the restaurants of famed chef Vitaly Paley. Chef finds himself in the Cascade foothills in search of the perfect berry. We learn about all varieties of blueberries and even get a chance to mingle with the resident falcon on patrol.Then its into the kitchen to create several dishes where the Northwest blueberry plays starring role.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table - Sunday Family Food
programme.desc: Sunday in Mérida is a joyous weekly celebration of food, dancing, and culture. The day is incomplete without a family meal. Luckily, chef Roberto Solís, of Néctar restaurant, welcomes Pati into his home for a traditional Sunday supper. Back at home, Pati whips up her own Sunday dinner for her own family, roasted pork tenderloin enchiladas covered in mole verde.

programme.title: Cucina Amore - Hunter's Chicken
programme.desc: Simple and hearty, chicken and mushrooms are simmered in tomato sauce and followed by creamy bread pudding for dessert.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Vegetables
programme.desc: Julia and Jacques prepare artichokes—several ways—including artichoke hearts stuffed with spinach and mushroom Duxelle. Julia demonstrates her secret to ever-green cooked string beans and butter bruised peas. Jacques counters with his aromatic Tomato Provencal.

programme.title: Infusion - Bread
programme.desc: Throughout recorded history bread has been popular around the world and is one of the oldest artificial foods having been of importance since the dawn of agriculture. Proportions of types of flour and other ingredients vary widely as do modes of preparation. As a result types shapes sizes and textures of breads differ around the world.

programme.title: Lidia's Italian Table - Manicotti & Cannelloni
programme.desc: Lidia cooks her mother Erminia’s and daughter and daughter Tanya’s favorite“Italian-American” recipes: Bubbly hot, cheese-filled Manicotti and aromatic savory Spinach-Meat Cannelloni, served right from the oven in a sizzling old-style baking dish. On the side, Lidia’s Italian “tri-colore” salad: Arugula, Tomato, Mozzarella.

programme.title: Great Wide Open - The Rock Star
programme.desc: Featuring Alex Honnold. Jared and Alex hike across Matthes Crest, then finish the night with a climb up Cathedral Peak.

programme.title: Great Wide Open - The Wolfman
programme.desc: Featuring Douglas Smith. Jared and Doug explore Yellowstone Park, and discuss the history of the wolf population in the park.

programme.title: Great Wide Open - Independence Day
programme.desc: Featuring Sasha DiGiulian. Jared and Sasha climb together and celebrate the 4th of July at the famous Devil's Tower.

programme.title: Great Wide Open - Les Trois Tetons
programme.desc: Featuring Peter Popinchalk. Jared and Peter hike and climb in the Grand Teton National Park.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Lisbon
programme.desc: Once the center of the richest empire in Europe, Lisbon now faces one of the worst financial crises in the EU. But even as it struggles with rising debt and unemployment, Lisbon is experiencing a cultural and culinary renaissance.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Kansas City
programme.desc: Tony travels to Kansas City, the BBQ capitol of the world, with pal Zamir Gotta, in search of the best barbeque. While there, Tony meets up with musicians, Dan and Patrick of The Black Keys for some serious finger licking meat.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Finland
programme.desc: In Finland, Tony joins musician Sami Yaffa for a liquored up tour of the world's only pub tram, a bloody sauna, and an unexpectedly exciting dinner with a cabbie's mother.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Baja
programme.desc: Tony tries his first-ever Mexican fish tacos in Baja, and then heads out with local Restaurateur, Javier Plascencia to a seafood street cart for sea urchin and clam tostadas. Many call it the best in the world!

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Penang
programme.desc: In Penang, Tony discovers a beautiful rice and shrimp dish wrapped in a banana leaf that he can't get enough of, then eats fresh snapper on Monkey Beach which surprisingly lives up to its name. Only problem, Tony hates monkeys.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Sydney
programme.desc: In this episode of No Reservations, Tony heads to Sydney to experience the enviable food and drink in the land down under. From the sheep farms of the blue mountains to the chic innovative restaurants of the big city, Sydney has recently become a mecca for meat-loving foodies. Tony eats fresh seafood, old school charcuterie, and the ubiquitous Australian barbie. In spite of the bad weather and presence of hipsters, the amazing meals make Tony want to look into local real estate.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations - Austin
programme.desc: Tony heads to Austin, Texas during South by Southwest - an international music festival. He hangs out with the band Sleigh Bells and enjoys roasted pig and crawfish with sausage followed by a tattoo given by the band's guitarist.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: A Moving Decision in Montana
programme.desc: Ben and Dylan are looking for a tiny home in rural Montana.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Tiny San Diego Digs for Three
programme.desc: Rachel, and lifelong Californian Josh fell in love when Rachel was on vacation.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Tiny Home Hunt in Huntsville
programme.desc: Eric and Cami were high school sweethearts in Spokane, WA.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: A Tiny Couple's Retreat in Louisville
programme.desc: Charles and Myra live in a spacious home.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: A Tiny Home for Tiny Harper

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: A Tiny Bachelor Pad in Phoenix
programme.desc: Matthew, a Phoenix native, is trying to piece his life back together.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Tiny Together in Cleveland
programme.desc: Anthony and Anthony are sick of living in pricey apartments.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Tiny Intervention in Cape Cod
programme.desc: Cathy tells her partner Andy that she's ready to downsize.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Going Tiny Family Style in Omaha
programme.desc: Jeff and Melany have three young daughters,

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Going Tiny in the Tetons
programme.desc: Erin and Lindsey are outdoor sports fanatics.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: A New Home for Newlyweds in Portland
programme.desc: Portland Oregonians Emmy and Jake would get married, and move into Jake's place.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Tiny Retreat in Coastal Maine
programme.desc: Celine is a doctor in Portland Maine.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Big Travelers Need Tiny Home in Nashville
programme.desc: Emily and Julian are constantly on the road.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: A Moving Decision in Montana
programme.desc: Ben and Dylan are looking for a tiny home in rural Montana.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Tiny San Diego Digs for Three
programme.desc: Rachel, and lifelong Californian Josh fell in love when Rachel was on vacation.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: Tiny Home Hunt in Huntsville
programme.desc: Eric and Cami were high school sweethearts in Spokane, WA.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: A Tiny Couple's Retreat in Louisville
programme.desc: Charles and Myra live in a spacious home.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting: A Tiny Home for Tiny Harper
programme.desc: Is 500 square foot living really compatible with family life?

programme.title: Ask TOH | EV Charger, New Sink
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner install an electric vehicle charger next to his house. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Then, Richard helps a homeowner install a new kitchen sink and faucet.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Thermostat, Solar
programme.desc: Roger teaches Kevin about lengths to consider when mowing the lawn. Richard travels to Pittsburgh to install a thermostat that interfaces with a smartphone to save energy and money. Ross Trethewey walks Kevin through the installation of a photovoltaic solar array on the barn. And Kevin, along with Tom, Richard and Roger ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | 35 Years of This Old House
programme.desc: In celebration of 35 years of This Old House, we look back at all that's changed in the last 35 years, and also what hasn't: our commitment to delivering trusted ideas and information to empower homeowners. This season begins in Boston's oldest neighborhood, Charlestown. Kevin and Norm highlight Charlestown's historical importance, from colonial times through WWII. Our new project is part of a cluster of 1850s-era Greek Revival houses tucked into the backside of Bunker Hill. Homeowner Angela Daigle shows Kevin the period feel and features of her home that she loves, but also the outdated kitchen and poor organization of space that she'd like to improve. Upstairs, Tom Silva shows Norm the spaces that will be getting minimal work: an existing guest room, guest bath, and living room. But one level up, on the third floor, it will likely be a full gut to give Angela a better master suite with additional living space, assuming the City approves the plan to enlarge the existing dormers. Out back, Roger shows Kevin the sad state of the crumbling retaining walls. Then Kevin finds Richard formulating a plan for the basement. Norm stops in next door to meet Maggie Boone to see how she recently addressed a lot of the same issues that Angela faces by renovating her own row house. And Norm and Tom test for lead paint before beginning demo on the first floor, as downstairs, Kevin, Richard and mason Mark McCullough start digging into the project.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Brick Rowhouse Blues
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Tom solving a major problem with the house: The exterior walls are bowing out from the weight of the roof over 160 years. His solution: build a structural wall inbound of the brick, lash the brick to the structure with threaded rods and epoxy, and then parge the whole thing. In the basement, news is brighter: Richard shows Kevin the result of two weeks of hand digging and a week of rough plumbing. The floor is down several inches, the sewer line tucked neatly in the floor, and the radiant heat/insulation system is currently going in. On the third floor, Norm shows Kevin how the roof has been under-structured since it was originally built. The structure they added in the 1980s helped, but it still needs more. Tom joins to get the first of two massive LVLs tucked into the pockets in the brick sidewalls, and fastened in place. To see how it's holding up, Norm revisits the townhouse we renovated in Charlestown 14 years ago. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin how he's going to open up the back wall for the new bump out. It starts with using two temporary steel "needles" through the reinforced rear wall to hold the weight of the house while a new steel beam is inserted. Then, the bricks can come down one by one to make a small new addition for the breakfast area.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Bridge to Charlestown
programme.desc: Richard gets up close and personal with one of Charlestown's most iconic structures-the Zakim Bridge-by talking with the structural engineer on the project, Ted Zoli. At the project house, Kevin finds the front of the building obscured by scaffolding it will be used to replace the failing asphalt roof, and also to build the dormer, if approval comes in from the City. Inside, Tom shows Kevin how he'll have to modify the old chimney for the new gas fireplace units, and they see the framing progress, including the new bump out for the breakfast area. The third floor master suite is all framed up, save the dormer, which is still in regulatory limbo. In the backyard, mason Mark McCullough presents options for rebuilding the decaying retaining walls at different price points. Then, they dig into the demolition, carrying all of the old wall material out through the house, by hand. Norm visits a salvage yard in Boston's South End that has dozens of architectural elements from the Greek Revival period, including a marble mantel and some glass doorknobs that are perfect for Angela's house. Several days later, Mark starts installing the homeowner's choice for the retaining wall: an interlocking concrete system with a bluestone cap. Richard shows Kevin the progress on the rough plumbing and electrical, including a high velocity mini duct system that will pair with an electric inverter heat pump unit to supply either air handlers or high wall cassette units. It's an efficient and quiet solution, which is perfect for this close-knit City location.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Wood and Water
programme.desc: Richard stops by the Charlestown Navy Yard to see a very special guest arrive: the last wooden whaling ship in the world, the Charles W. Morgan, which was built c.1840, just a decade before our project house. At the jobsite, Norm finds architect Sally DeGan, who shares the good news that after months of work and waiting, our new dormer was finally approved. Up at the roofline, Tom shows Norm the progress on the dormer, and how he's carefully waterproofing its low slope roof. Inside, Kevin notes progress: insulation went in a few days ago and wallboard is going up. Out back, to tie in the new work with the old house, mason Mark McCullough installs a reclaimed brick veneer on the new kitchen bump out. Kevin drops in to see kitchen designer Kathy Marshall at her studio in Wenham, Massachusetts, where she is working on the interior design details with homeowner Angela Daigle. For a more authentic look, Norm and Tom replace the fake, applied vinyl shutters on our house with authentic, operable shutters make out of durable fiberglass and PVC.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Gardens and Greek Revival
programme.desc: Roger visits the Sullivan Square Community Garden, while Richard works with fireplace expert John Sullivan to rough in the ductwork for the new direct vent gas fireplace units. With plaster work and flooring completed, Norm and Tom add some subtle Greek Revival details to the interior window trim package. For inspiration for her own urban garden, Roger takes homeowner Angela Daigle to see some the hidden gardens of Beacon Hill. Painting contractor Mauro Henrique paints the exterior window trim on our rowhouse, and puts up samples of a few bold color choices for the new front door

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Kitchens and Baths
programme.desc: Kevin finds Tom getting ready for a major upgrade to the front of the house: a new four-panel front door with glass transom and sidelights in traditional Greek Revival style. Inside, Kevin and Tom recall some of their favorite TOH kitchens over the years before seeing another one in progress Angela's cabinets have arrived from Pennsylvania. On the second floor, Tom and Kevin install new wood wainscoting to replace the worn out, poorly made version that used to be there. Norm learns about Charlestown's ancient past from city archaeologist Joe Bagley, who provides a rare look at his warehouse of artifacts in storage and testing at Boston's own archaeology lab. Tile contractor Mark Ferrante uses a marble basket weave tile from an online supplier to make a feature wall insert in the master shower. At the back addition, Kevin and Tom install a small section of copper roof to add a bit of character and long-term durability to the small roof

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Rowhouse, Lighthouse
programme.desc: Tom builds a hidden door to the basement by concealing it behind a system of rails and stiles that look like paneling. Marble specialist Danny Puccio shows Kevin the new Carrara marble island top and how they made the delicate ogee edge detail back at the shop. Angela gives Roger the news that despite a beautiful new design for her backyard, her budget is beyond stretched and she'll have to hold off on planting until next year. Fence contractor Mark Bushway installs a new PVC fence on top of the retaining wall to provide some privacy for the backyard. Richard heads out on the water to see how one intrepid homeowner is turning one of Boston's iconic lighthouses into his family's summer home. Norm and Tom restore the old, weather beaten exterior front steps with a grinder, a router, some epoxy, and a non-slip exterior paint. Stone specialist Steve Torok installs the salvaged marble mantel and surround in the sitting room

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Rowhouse Reimagined
programme.desc: After five months of work in Charlestown, the exterior is nicely restored thanks to a new dormer, windows, shutters, and front entry. Inside, Kevin finds systems integrator Greg Smizer test-driving the new internet-based security system, wireless music system and remote controlled window shades with solar battery back up. Norm meets closet designer Brian McSharry to see the pros and cons of designing a closet around a window. Richard shows Angela the basics of cooking with induction technology: her new cooktop relies on a magnetic field to generate heat within the pots and pans, instead of a traditional heating element. Norm meets up with Richard in the partially unfinished basement to see the mechanical room, where the systems integrate to provide comfort for the whole house. Kevin checks out Angela's new outdoor kitchen: powder coated stainless steel cabinets, a gas grill, and soapstone countertops. On the third floor, Kevin finds Angela and her mission accomplished: a serene master suite retreat where she can rest and relax. On the second floor, interior designer Kathy Marshall shows Norm the changes to the guest room, guest bath and bold new living room painted cranberry red, even on the ceiling. Downstairs, Kathy joins Angela and Kevin to see the former dining room transformed into a sophisticated sitting room, and all of the details of the new kitchen: cabinetry, tile, storage, a splashy new powder room, and the window seat addition that was worth all of the hard work

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Roots
programme.desc: This Old House kicks off the second project of their 35th Anniversary Season: an addition to a 1966 Colonial Revival in historic Lexington, Mass. With a history that extends back to the time of the American Revolution, Lexington is home to a strong tradition of Colonial-style homes that are still popular today. Homeowners Jeremy and Jody Kieval love the neighborhood but not necessarily the tall trees that hide the front of their house they'd like a curb appeal makeover that includes more sunlight and a big new farmer's porch. Inside, the front hall and dining room are working well, but the overflowing playroom needs to be relocated. Jeremy loves to cook and wants his dream kitchen to become the new heart of the home, so the nearly 50-year-old kitchen will be gutted and redesigned. Jody laments the lack of mudroom and access to the garage-but all of that will be taken care of by the new addition. All of the new upstairs space goes to the girls: the plan is to add two more bedrooms, a laundry room, and a sitting area over the garage. Norm meets architect Bill Hubner to discuss the features of the existing house, and how he's incorporated them into a plan for a sympathetic addition. In the 1980s-era great room, Richard explains why the tall room is hard to heat despite the best efforts of the baseboard and electric heat. Downstairs, the lack of insulation needs to be addressed and the heating and cooling systems may not be sized to support all of the new work in the addition. Roger shows Kevin the small stream in the backyard and the lengths that we're going go through to protect it during construction.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Footings and Foundations
programme.desc: Kevin discusses This Old House's history renovating Colonials and Colonial Revivals. The Lexington homeowners want to stay in their house during the renovation, so Tom shows Kevin how he's going to demo in phases, keeping the kitchen intact for as long as possible. Today, they'll do exterior demo only, starting with the back porch. Kevin visits a concrete shop in Amesbury, Massachusetts, to see them make the prefabricated concrete footings needed for our job. Norm explains the framing of the first floor platform from underneath, then climbs up on top to see how Tom is building the rear gable wall of the addition lying down: they sheath it, add the cellular PVC rake boards, and then stand the wall up. Roger gets underway with the layout and excavation for the new footings for the first floor addition. The new prefab footings are unloaded into the backyard, set, leveled and plumbed. Tom leaves them exposed so the inspector can sign off before back filling. Kevin explains the building permit process and the role of the building commissioner, Fred Lonardo, as he comes in to make his first inspection on the footings.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Curb Appeal
programme.desc: At the Lexington project, Kevin finds the front gable wall of the second floor up, and the roof framing underway. Around back, Tom installs a 24-foot long LVL to temporarily hold up the second floor while he adds new structure. Then, they frame the rest of the addition roof. Nearby in Lexington's historic district, architect Frank Shirley shows Norm how people have been using front porches to lend character and charm to Colonial style homes for hundreds of years. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin the framing of our new farmer's porch and then they build a small overhang to extend the look across the garage. Inside, Kevin sees how the homeowners are getting by without a kitchen, which has been gutted and is ready to be expanded thanks to a 24-foot steel beam that will carry the weight of the second floor. Later, Tom presents a solution to the ceiling height challenge in the old part of the kitchen: a structural ceiling that will allow him to gain some height over the islands, while allowing for both adequate structure, and a clever chase for wiring.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Smart Solutions
programme.desc: Norm visits the Hancock-Clarke house to see where Paul Revere stopped to warn John Hancock and Samuel Adams of the advancing British troops during the start of the American Revolution. Kevin recaps how the roofers applied new architectural shingles to tie the old house in with the new addition. Tom shows Kevin the progress on the new back deck, and how the architect has called for a corner stair leading down to the backyard. The framing requires two sets of traditional stringer systems, joined in the middle by a hip stringer and a series of jack stringers the same idea as framing a hip roof. Kevin finds Richard and plumbing contractor Kevin Bilo fighting to keep the P-trap from the new bathtub on the second floor from interfering with the decorative ceiling of the new kitchen. They use a new German bath waste and overflow kit that allows for the flexibility needed to solve the problem. Kevin and Norm finish up the trim and decking on the new corner deck stair. For the ipe deckboards that are sharply mitered in the corner, Norm has settled on using a floating tenon connection to prevent them from opening up over time

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Making Connections
programme.desc: Roger meets landscape designer Tim Lee to see how the small stream in the backyard affects all other areas of the yard, including a patch of grass that has to be returned to the wild, and a stand of trees out front that can now be removed after careful consideration by the Conservation Commission. Before the trees come down, Roger shows Kevin the valuable shade plants that could be damaged in the process, so they're relocated to a new bed in the side yard to provide screening from the neighboring house. Tom and Kevin cut away a five-foot section of wall to connect the new kitchen to the old great room. Richard shows Kevin two common rough plumbing conditions in the kitchen: a main sink that has a traditional drain and vent configuration, and an island prep sink, which requires a bow vent in order to work properly. Kevin meets building inspector Fred Lonardo to learn how a GC can call for a "partial framing inspection" to keep progress moving on a job, as in the case with our front porch. Arborist John Marquis shows Roger the proper preparation, safety precautions, and procedures for doing a "take down" of the 12 trees in the front yard.

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Exterior Details
programme.desc: Tom shows Kevin the new mudroom door and the work required to patch in new clapboards to match the old around it. Inside, two weeks of rough electrical is coming to a close as the subs call for their inspection. Kevin meets electrician Allen Gallant and inspector Alix Berube to see what goes into a rough electrical inspection. At the back deck, Tom shows Kevin how he's using a hybrid railing system that has cedar posts and railing caps, with stainless steel cable "balusters". Kevin visits kitchen designer Donna Venegas at her showroom at Boston's Design Center to see the neutrals, textures, and metallics that are currently trending in kitchens. Then, project designer Michele Kelly and homeowner Jeremy Kieval show Kevin the layout and design choices for the new family kitchen. With a house from 1966, almost anything goes, so paint color expert Bonnie Krims gives Kevin and homeowner Jody Kieval a range of options for the exterior colors

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Inspections
programme.desc: Norm and Tom install reinforced fiberglass columns to support the new farmer's porch. Richard meets plumbing contractor Brian Bilo and local plumbing inspector Donald "Duke" LaConte to see what he's looking for at our rough plumbing inspection. Kevin and Tom meet building commissioner Fred Lonardo to see what goes into the rough mechanical and rough framing inspections. After Fred signs off, insulation begins. Tom shows Kevin the storm window system he's using to enclose the screen porch, and Russell Parrot shows how we're going to heat the space: with electric radiant floor heat. Norm and Tom welcome back Fred Lonardo to review the various ways we can achieve the insulation value we need in our walls to meet code.

programme.title: Buying Back Home
programme.desc: Follow couples as they return to their roots to weigh their home-buying options in their beloved hometown.

programme.title: Made It
programme.desc: Lexi Petersen of Indiecords & Co. delights her fans with handmade, statement earrings.

programme.title: Made It
programme.desc: Known as the Knitting Bartender, Keenan Goldsmith has a passion for creating English country-inspired sweaters.

programme.title: Becoming Borderless
programme.desc: Newlyweds Adam & Destiny sold their home, bought a bus, renovated it, and have changed their lives forever.

programme.title: Becoming Borderless
programme.desc: Newlyweds Adam & Destiny sold their home, bought a bus, renovated it, and have changed their lives forever.

programme.title: Neat Freak
programme.desc: Sara Lynn Cauchon's cheeky take on home organizing that offers savvy solutions for sorting out life's messes.

programme.title: Rehabbed
programme.desc: Chris restores a stunning vanity, breaking free from the chains of low self-worth.

programme.title: Rehabbed

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars: Road Rage

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars: Hashtag Drama

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars: Mazed and Confused
programme.desc: When a stressful communication drill fails, the doctors confront the smoking issue. Tiffany seeks answers from Fizz and Nia. Soulja Boy is left feeling under water. And a boot camper is caught on camera facetiming someone other than their partner.

programme.title: Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars: Sex
programme.desc: The couples learn that Sex Day is not all fun and games when one person is caught Facetiming someone other than their partner. Soulja lets jealousy get the best of him, leaving Nia wanting to go home alone. And Lil' Mo wonders what is Karl hiding?

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 2 Chefs Compete (Part One)" - The two finalists must work with an architect to design restaurant spaces for their final dinner service competition.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 5, 2 Chefs Compete (Part Two)" - The final two contestants square off in their last dinner service competition. The winner gets the head chef job at the Borgata Hotel, Casino and Spa in Atlantic City.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 16 Chefs Compete" - In part one of the season premiere, sixteen contestants get a shot at culinary stardom and an executive chef position in the Canadian resort town of Whistler, British Columbia.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 15 Chefs Compete" - In the final part of the season premiere, a contestant from season five returns and the fifteen remaining chefs prepare for a seafood-accented dinner service by deveining shrimp.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 14 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay wakes up the remaining chefs in the middle of the night and orders them to prepare a spaghetti dinner for hungry firefighters. The losers must wash and wax fire engines.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 13 Chefs Compete" - The contestants must craft perfectly proportioned sausages for celebrities Drew Lachey, John O'Hurley, Tom Green, Melinda Clarke, Christopher "Kid" Reid and Kristy Swanson.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 12 Chefs Compete" - The twelve remaining chefs must plan a gastronomic salute to a returning U.S. Marine. The losing team will have to clean and decorate for Tana Ramsay's party.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 11 Chefs Compete" - The remaining chefs must create three-course meals that only total 700 calories. The winners hit the beach with Olympic beach volleyball player Annett Davis.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 10 Chefs Compete" - The remaining chefs roll dice to determine which ingredients they will use for their challenge dish. The winning team earns a trip to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 6, 9 Chefs Compete" - The nine remaining chefs take a blind taste test. The winners score a dinner date with Chef Ramsay in a pitch-black dining room where they can't see what they're eating.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited No. 7
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay revisits Spanish Pavillion, Kingston Cafe and La Frite to judge their progress after his initial consultations.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Park's Edge
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay stops at Park's Edge in Atlanta, where he finds a chaotic kitchen and severe signs of mismanagement.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Spin a Yarn
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits a fifty-year-old steakhouse. Despite the restaurant's rich history, it's long overdue for a visual and culinary makeover.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Charlie's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay pays Charlie's a visit. Located in La Verne, California, this Italian eatery suffers from a lackluster menu and outdated décor.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Cafe Hon
programme.desc: When a quaint Baltimore café suffers a public image ordeal, Chef Ramsay stops in for some damage control.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Chiarella's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay lends a helping hand to an Italian restaurant in Philadelphia that is hampered by a weak menu and poor service.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Classic American
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay arrives at debt-ridden eatery owned by two former waitresses. Things are so bad that Ramsay holds an intervention to address leadership and communication problems.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Mama Maria's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay drops by Mama Maria's, a pizzeria in Brooklyn with an exhausted owner and an unmanageable staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Fiesta Sunrise
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay helps out a family-run Mexican restaurant called Fiesta Sunrise — which is in deep financial trouble and extremely dirty. Can Ramsay get the family on the path to success?

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Dillon's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is in the Big Apple to revamp Dillon's, an Indian restaurant just blocks away from his own thriving eatery. Stubborn owner Mohammed loses approximately $25,000-$50,000 a month.

programme.title: The K2 EP07
programme.desc: Because of the strawberry ice cream delivered by Jae-ha, Anna has difficulty breathing due to an allergic reaction. Jae-ha is suffering from guilt and tries to force Jang Se-jun to come for sick Anna. But an unexpected situation occurs at a talk concert hall where Se-jun is located. Meanwhile, people recognize Anna as she roams the streets during the day. News of Barcelona's angel appearing in Korea spreads through SNS.

programme.title: The K2 EP08
programme.desc: Yoo-jin eliminates Park Kwan-soo and his surrounding political opponents one by one, creating a new power structure that she wants. But the only obstacle is the Barcelona angel, Anna. Due to people's keen interest, Anna is on the verge of being disclosed to the world, and Yoo-jin is trying to get rid of her by mobilizing troops. Recognizing this, Jae-ha tries to save Anna.

programme.title: The K2 EP09
programme.desc: Anna, who came out of the world, enjoys a happy moment for a while amid Jae-ha's dedication and protection, and feels that each other is settling in their hearts at some point. JB's family is embroiled in internal strife as the rebellion of Sung-won to push away the JSS. and Yoo-jin's anger clash. Anna, who stands by Sung-won's side to get revenge on Yoo-jin, and Jae-ha, who allied with Yoo-jin, now begins a dangerous tightrope walk.

programme.title: Jay Stevens - Life is Hilarious
programme.desc: Jay Stevens has been a professional comedian for almost 20 years. Growing up, he was known as a hilarious outgoing character by friends, family, colleagues and those he would meet on a first encounter.

programme.title: Rodney Laney - Who is Rodney Laney?
programme.desc: Rodney Laney has completed pilots for Comedy Central, MTV, and A&E. He has been seen on HBO, FOX News Channel’s Red Eye, The Late Late Show on CBS, Comedy Central’s Premium Blend, comedy.tv on the HD channel, two appearances on Gotham Comedy Live AXSTV, and Live in Gotham VR. He has appeared at the prestigious Just for Laughs Comedy Festival Montreal and LOL Lounge TBS Presents A Very Funny Festival: Just for Laughs Chicago.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Robert Mac - Back to Lake Titicaca
programme.desc: Robert Mac returns to the Dry Bar stage with less smartness, less subtleness, and even more silliness.

programme.title: Byron Trimble - Diary of a Short City Boy
programme.desc: Byron Trimble has traveled around the world doing comedy for conferences, churches, retreats, clubs, schools, and corporate events. He has been featured on NBC, ABC, Living Oklahoma, and the Dan Patrick Show. His hilarious blend of music and comedy in his live shows and the following generated by his online videos have enabled him to share the stage with nationally known comedians like John Crist and Anita Renfroe. Raised in Detroit, MI, he now lives in Tulsa, OK with his beautiful wife, Hannah, and three young children. Yet, he says his greatest success might be being a pastors kid his whole life and never being arrested.

programme.title: Kristin Key - Crafty
programme.desc: Kristin Key grew up a minister’s daughter in a small town in West Texas. Much like Footloose, she was raised in a no-drinking, no-dancing, no instrumental music environment. She seemed like any other well-behaved girl… until she opened her mouth. It was obvious from the beginning that she had a quick wit and undeniable sense of humor.

programme.title: Lamont Ferguson - You Had All Day
programme.desc: Ferguson has appeared on the Tonight Show, Comedy Central, Comics Unleashed and ABCís Family Channel. He was the Winner of the Seattle International Comedy Competition, Three time semi-finalist at the Boston Comedy Festival, Finalist in the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and named ëBest of Festî at the Detroit, Lucky Eagle and San Luis Obispo Comedy Festivals. He has the distinction of being one of the only comics in the country that has opened for all of the following comedians: Steve Harvey, George Lopez, Larry Miller, Garry Shandling, Richard Jeni, and George Carlin.

programme.title: Brad Upton - Will Be Funny For Money
programme.desc: Brad Upton first stepped on stage in September of 1984 and he's never looked back. This ex-grade school teacher is now in his 30th year of comedy and is nearing 6000 lifetime performances. He is a past winner of the Las Vegas Comedy Festival and appeared recently at Caesar's Palace as part of the HBO Comedy Festival. He has spent the last eight years as the opening act for the legendary Johnny Mathis and did multiple shows all over the country with the late, great Joan Rivers. He has also been seen in concert with The Smothers Brothers, Smokey Robinson, Kenny Rogers, Dolly Parton, Lewis Black, George Jones, Glen Campbell, Pam Tillis and many others. Coast to coast all over North America isn't the only place Brad performs. In 2014 Brad headlined in Singapore, Hong Kong, The MGM in Macau and did eight nights in Israel as part of the Comedy for Koby benefit. His new CD entitled, "Brad Uptonogood" is heard regularly on Sirius Satellite Radio and is available online wherever music is sold. He also just released his first DVD entitled, "Brad Upton, Live from the 509".

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Andy Hendrickson - Left Field
programme.desc: Andy Hendrickson has multiple TV appearances including: The Late Show with David Letterman, The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, Gotham Comedy Live, NBC/Seeso’s The Guest List and more. Internationally, Andy has performed at clubs and festivals throughout the world, including Canada, England, Holland, and Ireland. He also performed for our troops on Outback’s Feeding Freedom Tour that provided entertainment for the troops on military bases across Afghanistan.

programme.title: Ty Barnett - Yep
programme.desc: Ty Barnett, a Chicago native, got his start at Seattle’s Comedy Underground. Whoopi Goldberg called Ty “hilarious” and reviewers have said he is “thought provoking” and “edgy”. All this praise earned him many television appearances. He hosted the Food Network’s Mealin’ and Dealin’, Discovery Family’s Babies Behaving Badly and Beasts Behaving Badly, and appeared in over 15 national commercials. It all began when he was one of the two finalists on the most-watched and Emmy nominated season of Last Comic Standing. Ty went on to multiple Tonight Show appearances where Jay Leno called Ty “one of the funniest comedians working”. He also appeared in HBO’s Bad Boys of Comedy, his own Comedy Central Presents and one-hour special Issues. Ty was named “one to watch” by the Hollywood Reporter. He’s also been seen on the sitcoms Samantha Who, Til Death, Life in Pieces, NickMom Night Out and Tosh.O. His comedy album, Grown Man-Baby Steps is a favorite on Sirius XM.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Reno Collier - Monkeys and Stuff
programme.desc: Reno's journey began at the Punchline Comedy Club in Atlanta, GA where he tended bar to supplement his day job. He found himself on stage during the weekly open mic night. His unique outlook on life - mixed with a six-pack, was instantly popular.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Richard Sarvate - Missed the Window
programme.desc: Richard Sarvate quit his ten year programming career in Silicon Valley to be a stand up comedian. Oops! Now he spends his nights poking fun at tech jobs.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Cam Bertrand - Sophisticated Ignorance
programme.desc: Cam shares his outlook on relationships and life through the eyes of a 23-year-old in a way that everyone can relate to. Bringing high energy and witty style that appeals to a wide demographic.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Marty Simpson - I Am Coach
programme.desc: Former high school football coach and drama teacher, Marty Simpson jokes about how to punish teenagers, getting rid of 500 bats in his attic, and how his love language is sarcasm.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Joe Zimmerman - Captain Snuggle Pants
programme.desc: Joe Zimmerman grew up in Morgantown, West Virginia, and started his comedy career in North Carolina. While living in the South, his stand-up group the Beards of Comedy landed a record deal with Comedy Central Records.

programme.title: Aaron Woodull - Unknown
programme.desc: Adored by girlfriends' mothers everywhere, Aaron Woodall is a nice, young man coming to grips with a dirty, cynical world. Whether it be the lack of car horns for polite people, or the horrors of childbirth, or the disappointing reality of true love, Aaron always shares his disillusions with a sense of with wide-eyed excitement.His unique perspective has been entertaining sold-out comedy clubs and half-empty bars across the West for the last four years. In 2015, Aaron made his national television debut when he performed on "Laughs" on FOX, and this year he can be seen hosting the new hidden camera pranks show "Random Acts" on BYUtv.

programme.desc: Chee and T are underachieving debt collectors stuck in Silicon Valley.

programme.desc: It's a wild night in 1989 of raucous fun as Bill Hicks shows us his unique view on smoking cigarettes.

programme.desc: Veteran comedian George Wallace welcomes Preacher Lawson & Mike Falzone to the stage.

programme.title: Michael Yo: Blasian
programme.desc: Michael Yo talks about the issues growing up half Black and Asian in a place where he really stood out.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - The Phantom Creeps
programme.desc: Bela Lugosi! An ugly robot! The power of invisibility! A military intelligence officer romancing an ambitious reporter! All of these exciting-sounding elements are undeniably contained within the runtime of The Phantom Creeps! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Flash That Smile
programme.desc: RiffTrax, the guys who make movies funny, bring their comedic riffing treatment to the short Flash That Smile! Floss your way to fun as Bridget and Mary Jo pull on their neon spandex and take you on a 15 minute oral hygiene adventure.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Mind Ripper
programme.desc: In a remote bunker in the desert, unthinkable experiments are taking place. Experiments where horror legend Wes Craven sells his name and credibility to a movie in exchange for a writing credit for his son Jonathan! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX LIVE - House On Haunted Hill
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic live riffing treatment to this classic horror shocker starring Vincent Price! A millionaire offers $10,000 to a group of strangers to spend the night in The House On Haunted Hill. Join Mike, Kevin, Bill, and Paul F. Tompkins for an unforgetttable night in RiffTrax Live The House On Haunted Hill.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Trucker's Woman
programme.desc: If the old dusty carousel of audio cassettes at a truck stop could be distilled into a movie, this would be that movie. From the title to the fashion to the hair to the faces, one of the most 70s things you will ever experience is Trucker’s Woman! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - The Myths of Shoplifting
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short about the perils of shoplifting. Watch as teens attempt to steal makeup, records, and even a pocket calculator! Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill as they tackle The Myths of Shoplifting.

programme.title: RiffTrax Live: Star Raiders
programme.desc: Out of this chaos a hero rises: the dashing, exquisitely bearded Captain Saber Raine (Casper Van Dien).This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).
